windows.symptom: Windows 10 October 2019 Update messes up Chrome Browser        My computer just updated to the newest version yesterday. It is Version 10.0.17763 Build 17763. Right after that when I tried to use the Chrome Browser I started getting slow responses loading pages with a message on the bottom of the page saying " establishing secure connection". Some pages would finally load, others just kept spinning. Very frustrating. I tried reinstalling chrome, changing network adapter protocols, nothing worked. I have an AMD FX processor with Radeon graphics card. Many people seem to be having the same problem. I finally got it fixed by visiting different forums. I had to go to services, then scroll to cryptographic services and change to local network. I did this as an administrator when opening the services plug-in. All pages load fast now. My problem is that just now I went to log into services, as an administrator, and it said I was blocked for my protection. How can I get back into the services app? I am the one who changed it, why would I now be blocked? I am so upset. First, the update should never have been released with it messing up Chrome that badly. Second I went to answers on the  Microsoft forum and only users gave the fix, not the administrators. Now I am locked out of my services app. What if I need to change something else? Oh yea, and it took me all of last night and 4 hours today to fix it because I was afraid to change the setting. Some people said changing the service to local network would affect updates in the future. I finally did change it because I was so frustrated with my chrome not working. How can I get back into my services app now that it blocks me? I right clicked run as administrator and still am blocked. This is really messed up.
solutions: Hi Eldon, I'm Stefano an Independent Advisor, here to help you. Windows 10 1903 has been released, so, before trying anything else, I suggest you to manually update to this version. You can Update to Windows 10 1903 using Windows Update Assistant:https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=799445Once done, please check if everything seems working well, then check if the problem is solved this way, or if you need help restoring the access to services.

I am afraid to update windows again to be honest after what I just went through. I may try it soon, but just for now could you help me get back into my services app? I would be so grateful. Thank you. I appreciate the quick response.

Well then, First of all, I suggest you to check your account. You have to be sure to be administrator. To check that:1. Press WINDOWS + i2. Click on "Account"3. Be sure that under your account info there Is AdministratorThen, please check your filesystem:1. Type "cmd" in windows search bar2. Right click on "Command Prompt"3. Select "Run as Administrator"4. Type "sfc /scannow" without quote and press ENTER Please let me know if that procedure returns errors not solved.

Same issue here.  I have even reloaded windows from scratch twice now and every time that Fall update hits it ruins chrome. I ran the cmd you said above on my system and got this back: Windows Resource Protection found corrupt files but was unable to fix some of them.For online repairs, details are included in the CBS log file located atwindir\Logs\CBS\CBS.log. For example C:\Windows\Logs\CBS\CBS.log. For offlinerepairs, details are included in the log file provided by the /OFFLOGFILE flag.

This problem is wide spread on PC's with all the latest updates of Windows 10, using Chrome.The quickest way to solve this is to run Chrome in compatibility mode.  Right click Chrome, go to properties, select Compatibility table and tick run this program in compatibility mode and set to Windows 8.We have found this solves the issue.

Same issue here.  For the past week or so, some pages load properly but others absolutely will not load properly.  "Chrome unresponsive" is the message received.  The very worst appears to be Facebook, but other also slow at best.   I'm not 'techy' at all, so there's no way I'm going to start messing with systems settings myself.
Absolutely convinced it's intentional effort to drive us to Microsoft Edge and Bing.  Google should look into this.
Absolutely convinced it's intentional effort to drive us to Microsoft Edge and Bing.  Google should look into this.I think you're right.

Well I left Microsoft Explorer years ago due to so many issues there, and have gotten used to Google over the years, so I'm not willing to switch back now.  I was never a fan of Bing.  Our work IT department originally switched all of us to Bing back in the mid 2000's.  That lasted about a year, and then they switched us all back to Google.
I had to set my compatinility mode to Windows 8 tonight. It seems to have fixed all my issues. Hopefully it lasts.

windows.symptom: Windows 10 stopped detecting ThinkVision M14 monitor        I have been using a ThinkVision M14 monitor with a USB-C adapter for some time, but it suddenly stopped working a few days ago.  It is not detected by Windows 10 64 bit.  The monitor works fine with a different computer and it will turn out with external power.  I cannot see it in the device manager and the display settings say that it cannot detect another monitor.
solutions: Hi, Thank you for writing to Microsoft Community Forums. I understand that you are unable to use ThinkVision M14 monitor on your computer. I’ll help you with the issue. However, please let us know: Are you aware of any changes made to the computer recently?What is the make and model of the computer that you are using? As you have mentioned that you are able to use the monitor with a different computer, I suspect it could be an issue with the drivers on the computer. I would suggest you to check for hidden drivers on the computer and try to update them. Refer the steps mentioned below: Press Windows Logo key + X, and selectDevice Manager.Click on View and select Show hidden devices.Expand Monitors and check if there is anyhidden device.If there is any hidden device, right click on it and selectUpdate Driver. You can also install ThinkVision M14 Monitor Driver and see if that makes any difference. Since you are using a USB-C adapter, I suggest you to refer the article onFix USB-C problems. You may also try updating the Chipset drivers from the computer manufacturer’s website and then check if the Monitor is detected. Let us know the results. Regards,Nikhar KhareMicrosoft Community - Moderator

windows.symptom: WiFi Driver can't be installed properly        Hi,I need the only network cable I currently have for another device, so I have to use my WiFi adapter on my PC for now. However, I noticed that it's very slow (avg 5 Mbps). My internet connection is actually a lot faster (avg 60 Mbps) and it works fine on other devices and on the PC when using the cable. I checked it in the device manager and it used a very old Microsoft compatibility driver from 2017, so I used the update driver feature and it found and installed a driver from 29/10/2019 version 19.51.26.1 but it was still very slow. So I decided to try this most recent driver (21.60.2) from the manufacturer (my adapter is an Intel Dual Band Wireless-AC 3168) but for some reason I can't install it. The installation works fine and it even says that it has been completed successfully (first screenshot) but when I check it in the device manager after the installation it's still the compatibility driver 19.51.26.1 (second screenshot) and it's also still very slow. Does anybody have any idea how I can get it to install the Intel driver properly?
solutions: Ok go back to the "device manager" Right click on this driver Click on properties Go to the "driver" tab Click on "update driver" Then click on "browse my computer for driver software" And now click on "let me pick from a list avaible dirvers on my computers" Then see if in the list, the new driver is there? If yes, select it, do next ... follow the steps if there are others, and do ok. Then reboot and see if it got updated
Right click on the start button, and go to "device manager". Expand " network adapter " and you will see your wifi card. Right click on it and select " uninstall. Then, reinstall the new, and reboot.

When all was said and done , performance was slightly worse and now I have a reoccurring display problem. My extend dual monitor setup goes back to single monitor , with the second monitor recognized but disabled. When I enable it , all the color information is remembered but the Hz is reset. It is really inconvenient and I cannot rollback the update because its been more than 10 days. Why must these updates that suck be forced upon us? You do realize we pay for this garbage? Can I have my money back? Can you please fix this garbage? Something? Hello?Running Laptop , sager , 16 g ddr4 ,i7 6600k , nvidia 1070 , all ssd hd , win10 ,  version 1809 build 17763.914Nothing peculiar in device manager********************* Using a live chat , during troubleshooting , we went into power options / what happens when power button pushed /  and found an option for fast boot and disabled it. Upon shutdown and power on , this problem did not reproduce.************

I printed out the text test page and it worked.  My concern is that MS is breaking printers and people are not going to know what to do , and will not get it fixed as in my own case and I had to throw away a good printer because I did not realize it was a update from MS that broke it.MS needs to be aware of this problemKerry

windows.symptom: 0x87af040a error code when downloading from Microsoft store        Nothing works. Not one damn download works at the Microsoft store works. From games to the Windows calculator. They all give me the same error code. I talked to customer service and he was clueless. Is there a fix for this or is the Microsoft store completely useless?
solutions: Hi DonCasey2, First thing you can try is running the windows store troubleshooter to check if it can fix the issue. You can also try disabling firewall or anti-virus temporarily and see if those are preventing you to download the apps. You can also try running the system file checker tool to check if there are any corrupted registry causing the error. Please follow steps below.1. Open an elevated command prompt. To do this, right click the Windows button, and then select Command Prompt (Admin). If you are prompted for an administrator password or for a confirmation, type the password, or click Allow or Yes.2. Type the following command, and then press Enter. DISM.exe /Online /Cleanup-image /Restorehealth - Note It might take several minutes for the command operation to be completed. 3. Type the following command and press Enter. sfc /scannow - Note It might take several minutes for the command operation to be completed. Let me know how it goes.
I'm still getting the same error code. Nothing downloads from the Microsoft store

Hi DonCasey2, Thanks for giving it a try. Can you try restart the windows store service? Go to start>run> Type services.msc then look for WSService and restart the serviceYou can also clear windows Store cache by following instructions below. Run CMD as administrator, type WSReset.exe and hit Enter.
It still doesn't work

Hi, DonCasey2 My name is Jeffrey and I am an Independent Advisor. I would be happy to help you today.Follow these steps to repair the Microsoft Store and Apps: 1) launch powershell 2) Set-ExecutionPolicy Unrestricted You have to select (Yes to All) 3) Get-AppXPackage -AllUsers | Foreach {Add-AppxPackage -DisableDevelopmentMode -Register "$($_.InstallLocation)\AppXManifest.xml"}Restart your system Check the link to better understand how to execute the commands: https://www.digitalcitizen.life/how-reinstall-a...You can also download this application to try to repair the Microsoft Store. http://aka.ms/diag_apps10You can also reset the Microsoft Store https://www.tenforums.com/tutorials/15057-clear...Note: This is a non-Microsoft website. The page appears to be providing accurate, safe information. Watch out for ads on the site that may advertise products frequently classified as a PUP (Potentially Unwanted Products). windows.symptom: Driver  Easy        Hi. I wanted to ask the community if the Software Driver Easy is a legit-able and safe Driver updater. I have an Acer PC running Windows 10. I find the the Acer site don't give all the possible Driver updates that Driver Easy does. Thanks in advance
solutions: Hi, I'm David an independent advisor and user just like you. I'll do my best to help you with this.In my opinion the software isn't going to be much help. It will run a scan and supposedly recommend a series of drivers which require to be updated - if I recall correctly it will then want you to subscribe to their service before actually giving you the drivers.Current/latest drivers are available from the the manufacturer, or directly from Microsoft via Windows Update - for free. There should be no need to use any additional app to assist with obtaining drivers. The developers of the app aren't going to have access to drivers that you can't otherwise obtain yourself. I would advise to stay clear. Regards, David

No driver update software is legitimate.When it comes to updating drivers, there is no replacement for your own judgement.Here are some general principles:1- Only the hardware manufacturer can write drivers for their hardware. Not Microsoft, and not anyone else.2- As a direct result of the above, drivers are available from the manufacturer on the manufacturer's website.  (The drivers that are included with Windows come from hardware manufacturers.)3- Drivers are always free.4- Although it may seem contra-intuitive, your goal is not to always have the most recent drivers for your hardware. With rare exceptions, updated drivers are issued to solve problems. If your hardware is not experiencing a problem that is addressed by an updated driver, you have no reason to install an updated driver.

solutions: Hi, WilliamBurrell1 My name is Jeffrey and I am an Independent Advisor. I would be happy to help you today.Try to follow these steps to repair your Internet connections: Enter the Start menu or by pressing the Win + I key combination, open the Settings and click on the Network and Internet option. Once there, we select the Status option from the menu on the left side and, within the configurations and options that are loaded in the right panel, we have to look for the restoration of the network. When you click on this option, it will show us a new window from where we can restore the network in Windows 10. In this way, all network adapters will be removed and reinstalled, and the original configuration of other network components will be restored. net. This implies that if we were using some software, such as a VPN client or virtual switches, we will have to reinstall them.A process that the system performs automatically by clicking on the Reset button that is now displayed in Network Reset in Windows 10 settings. It is normal for the process to not take long, although we must wait until the end completely and restart the computer to continue with the network configuration in Windows 10 as we have done so far.https://www.kapilarya.com/how-to-reset-network-...https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/help/10741/...You can also check that your drivers are updated. https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/help/402844...Note: This is a non-Microsoft website. windows.symptom: Snip & Sketch reports error notification "Something Went Wrong" when attempting to save image as a file        Snip & Sketch App says "Something went wrong"When using the Microsft Windows 10 app named Snip & Sketch. Every time I would select an image and attempt to save the image as a file. I would click the icon to save to file and I would get a notification that reads "Something Went Wrong." And the app would not allow me to save the image into a file for later use.I searched the web and couldn't find the fix. So I began searching my computers app options. And I found the fix.Here is an image the Snip & Sketch notification error. The error appears once you have clicked the save icon which is the icon of the floppy disc.THE FIX: Open your SETTINGS then choose APPS. Under the APPS & FEATURES option scroll down to your SNIP & SKETCH app. Select and click the app. There will be a small drop-down menu with two options; (1) Advanced Options (2) Uninstall. Choose (1) Advanced Options.After clicking the advanced options link. You will be viewing the advanced options of the snip & sketch application. (Image below). Under the header that reads APP PERMISSIONS. There is an option named PICTURES that has an on and off switch located beneath the word pictures. You need to click that button and turn the option on.Once you have turned on that advanced app option. You will now be able to save a clipped image into a file.I hope this helps somebody out there in the web. Best wishes!
solutions: This almost worked... it gave me the clue I needed... App Permissions could not be set to "on".  I had to go to Settings:Privacy:App Permissions:Pictures (allow access to picture libraries on this device.   Then I set "allow apps to access your picture library" to "on" and then lower down set "choose which apps can access you picture library and selected Snip and Sketch and set it to "on"  Now works.....
